alert.note: Alert for Hendry; Inland Palm Beach County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 9:11PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Hendry and western Palm Beach Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 911 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud 8 miles northwest of Canal Point, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Belle Glade, Clewiston, Pahokee, South Bay, Canal Point, Lake Harbor, Okeelanta, Belle Glade Camp, Fremd Village-Padgett Island and Harlem. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows.
